factoid: Princess Mary spoke to Prince Andrew from beside the cot where she was standing
Princess Mary said better wait a bit later
Prince Andrew said Oh leave off you always talk nonsense and keep putting things off and this is what comes of it
Prince Andrew's words were intended to wound Princess Mary
Princess Mary said My dear really its better not to wake him he is asleep
Prince Andrew got up and tiptoed up to the little bed with a wineglass in hand
Prince Andrew said Perhaps we would really better not wake him
Princess Mary said As you please really I think so but as you please
Princess Mary felt intimidated and confused that her opinion had prevailed
Princess Mary drew Prince Andrew's attention to the maid who was calling him in a whisper
It was the second night that neither Princess Mary nor Prince Andrew had slept while watching the boy who was in a high fever
Princess Mary and Prince Andrew had been trying first one remedy and then another for the boy
Princess Mary and Prince Andrew mistrusted their household doctor and were expecting another doctor whom they had sent to town
Princess Mary and Prince Andrew were sleepless and anxious and threw their burden of sorrow on each other, reproached, and disputed
The maid whispered to Princess Mary that Pétrusha had come with papers from Prince Andrew's father
Prince Andrew went out of the room
Prince Andrew muttered Devil take them after listening to verbal instructions his father had sent and taking correspondence and his father's letter
Prince Andrew returned to the nursery after taking the letters
Prince Andrew asked Well
Princess Mary whispered Still the same Wait for heaven's sake Karl Ivánich always says that sleep is more important than anything
Prince Andrew went up to the child and felt the child's body
The child was burning hot
Prince Andrew said Confound you and your Karl Ivánich
Prince Andrew took the glass with drops and again went up to the cot
Princess Mary said Andrew don't
Prince Andrew scowled at Princess Mary angrily while also showing suffering in his eyes
Prince Andrew stooped the glass in hand over the infant
Prince Andrew said But I wish it
Prince Andrew said I beg you give it him
Princess Mary shrugged her shoulders but took the glass submissively
Princess Mary called the nurse and began giving the medicine to the child
The child screamed hoarsely when given the medicine
Prince Andrew winced and clutching his head went out and sat down on a sofa in the next room
Prince Andrew still had all the letters in his hand
Prince Andrew opened the letters mechanically and began reading them
Prince Andrew wrote that he had just received very joyful news from a special messenger
Prince Andrew wrote that Bennigsen had obtained a complete victory over Buonaparte at Eylau
Prince Andrew wrote that in Petersburg everyone was rejoicing
Prince Andrew wrote that rewards were sent to the army and were innumerable
Prince Andrew wrote that he was a German and congratulated the commander at Kórchevo
Prince Andrew wrote that the commander at Kórchevo was up to something unknown
Prince Andrew wrote that additional men and provisions had not arrived yet
Prince Andrew wrote that he wanted the commander at Kórchevo to come immediately and that he would have his head off if everything was not there in a week
Prince Andrew wrote that he had received another letter about the Preussisch-Eylau battle from Pétenka
Prince Andrew wrote that Pétenka had taken part in the battle
Prince Andrew wrote that the letter was true
Prince Andrew wrote that when mischief-makers did not meddle even a German beats Buonaparte
Prince Andrew wrote that Buonaparte was said to be fleeing in great disorder
Prince Andrew wrote that he wanted the commander at Kórchevo to come immediately and carry out instructions
Prince Andrew sighed and broke the seal of another envelope
The envelope contained a closely written letter of two sheets from Bilíbin
Prince Andrew folded the letter without reading it
Prince Andrew reread his father's letter
Prince Andrew's father's letter ended with the words Gallop off to Kórchevo and carry out instructions
Prince Andrew thought No pardon me I won't go now till the child is better
Princess Mary was still standing by the cot gently rocking the baby
